instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2828: What is 820-2828? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: iMac 27" 2011 - no backlight - turns on for 1 second on boot
threads.message:
Hey,

any idea for this problem?

iMac 27" 2011 Backlight not working.

Graphics good, iMac boots, externally fully functional.


The backlight turn on for 1 second when i press the power button - then shuts off.

LED driver board is replaced. Same problem.



Any ideas?

threads.title: iMac 27" 2011 - no backlight - turns on for 1 second on boot
threads.message:
Can you post 820-xxxx code of your board?
Any history fault available?

Confirm if image is present, only missing backlight.

threads.title: iMac 27" 2011 - no backlight - turns on for 1 second on boot
threads.message:
dont know the 820 code..

27" 2011

machine of a strong smoker...

image is present - only backlight is missing. backlight turns on for 1 second on boot, then shuts off..

threads.title: iMac 27" 2011 - no backlight - turns on for 1 second on boot
threads.message:
It should be <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2828</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, but you should post correct code when open new thread!

Check <SIGNAL>VIDEO_ON</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>BL_EN</SIGNAL>, with LCD connected.
